article_title: The bottom line: how employers save millions by replacing COBRA with Obamacare
article_text:
Imagine this. You’re a self-insured employer with 500 former employers enrolled in COBRA. With average claim costs of $10,589 per person, you have a $5.3 million expense on your balance sheet. That’s right—$5.3 million, for people that don’t even work for you. This isn’t a hypothetical. One employer I met with had this exact scenario. The amount of COBRA costs often ignored by employers can be staggering.

Read this white paper to find out why employers need a COBRA alternative.
